table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: The Well package is used to simulate a specified flux to individual cells and specified in units of length

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.link: Harbaugh, A.W., Banta, E.R., Hill, M.C., and McDonald, M.G., 2000, MODFLOW-2000, the U.S. Geological Survey modular ground-water model -- User guide to modularization concepts and the Ground-Water Flow Process: U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 00-92, 121 p.
Niswonger, R.G., Panday, Sorab, and Ibaraki, Motomu, 2011, MODFLOW-NWT, A Newton formulation for MODFLOW-2005: U.S. Geological Survey Techniques and Methods 6-A37, 44 p.

li.text: package is used to simulate a specified flux distributed over the top of the model and specified in units of length/time. Within MODFLOW, these rates are multiplied by the horizontal area of the cells to which they are applied to calculate the volumetric flux rates.
package can be used to simulate a specified flux to particular cells specified in units of length

text.style: font-family:'Times New Roman'; font-size:8pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-transform:none; vertical-align:super; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

li.text: /time and varying as a function of time within stress periods.

para.text: Input to the Well (WEL) Package is read from the file that has type "WEL" in the

file. Optional variables are shown in brackets. All variables are free format if the option “FREE” is specified in the Basic Package input file; otherwise, the non-optional variables have 10-character fields and the optional variables are free format.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Item 0 is optional—“#” must be in column 1. Item 0 can be repeated multiple times.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Text—is a character variable (199 characters) that starts in column 2. Any characters can be included in Text. The “#” character must be in column 1. Except for the name file, lines beginning with # are restricted to these first lines of the file. Text is printed when the file is read.
This optional item must start with the word “

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NPWEL—is the number of well parameters.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MXL—is the maximum number of wells that will be defined using parameters.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: MXACTW—is the maximum number of wells in use during any stress period. MXACTW includes wells that are defined using parameters as well as wells that are defined without using parameters.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IWELCB—is a flag and a unit number.

li.text: If IWELCB > 0, it is the unit number to which cell-by-cell flow terms will be written when "SAVE BUDGET" or a non-zero value for
If IWELCB = 0, cell-by-cell flow terms will not be written.
If IWELCB < 0, well recharge for each well will be written to the listing file when "SAVE BUDGET" or a non-zero value for

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Option—is an optional list of character values.

li.text: abc”—defines an auxiliary variable, named "abc", which will be read for each well as part of Items 4 and 6. Up to 20 variables can be specified, each of which must be preceded by "AUXILIARY" or "AUX." These variables will not be used by the Ground-Water Flow Process, but they will be available for use by other processes. The auxiliary variable values will be read after the Q variable.
”—indicates that memory should be allocated to store cell-by-cell flow for each well in order to make these flows available for use in other packages. (This option is only available in MODFLOW-2000.)

para.text: Data set 2b can only be specified in versions of MODFLOW that include the
solver. PHIRAMP is only used if
is the selected solver. Otherwise, it is ignored.
is a keyword option used to specify a value for PHIRAMP. If
is not specified then a default value of 0.05 is used.

PHIRAMP is the fraction of the cell thickness used as an interval for smoothly adjusting negative pumping rates to 0 for dry cells. Negative pumping rates are adjusted to 0 or a smaller negative value when the head in the cell is equal to or less than the calculated interval above the cell bottom (see equations 24 and 25 on page 14 of Niswonger and others, 2011).

Changes were made to report wells with reduced pumping due to dewatered conditions to a separate output file or to the main listing file. If the wells with reduced pumping rates are written to a separate output file then a file of type "DATA" must be included in the Name file with a unit number that matches the unit number specified in the Well file (following the variable PHIRAMP in Item 2b). For example, a value of PHIRAMP (see MODFLOW-NWT documentation report) of 0.3 and a unit number of 50 can be specified in the second line of the Well file using the key word "SPECIFY" as:
The following line must be added to the Name file:

Thus, wells with reduced pumping will be written for each time step to the output file "Reduced_wells.out" with unit number 50. For example, wells with reduced pumping will be reported to file "reduced_wells.out" as:
WELLS WITH REDUCED PUMPING FOR STRESS PERIOD 6 TIME STEP 2
LAY ROW COL APPL.Q ACT.Q GW-HEAD CELL-BOT
WELLS WITH REDUCED PUMPING FOR STRESS PERIOD 6 TIME STEP 3
LAY ROW COL APPL.Q ACT.Q GW-HEAD CELL-BOT
If PARNAM is to be a time-varying parameter, the keyword “
” and a value for NUMINST must be entered.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PARNAM—is the name of a parameter. This name can consist of 1 to 10 characters and is not case sensitive. That is, any combination of the same characters with different case will be equivalent. All parameter names must be unique.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PARTYP—is the type of parameter. For the WEL Package, the only allowed parameter type is Q, which defines values of the volumetric recharge rate.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NLST—is the number of wells that are included in a non-time-varying parameter or in each instance of a time-varying parameter.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: – is an optional keyword that designates a parameter as time varying. The keyword is case-insensitive; that is, it may be entered in any combination of upper- and lower-case letters. If
is present, it must be followed by a value for NUMINST. If
is absent, PARNAM is non-time-varying and NUMINST should not be present.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NUMINST – is the number of instances that are included in the definition of a time-varying parameter, where each instance is a list of wells and associated properties. If the keyword
is present, NUMINST must be present and must be at least 1. If the keyword
is absent, NUMINST should not be present.
repetitions of Item 4 (parts a and b) are read. After each repetition of Item 4a,

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: INSTNAM – is the name of an instance associated with the parameter PARNAM specified in the corresponding Item 3. The name can consist of 1 to 10 characters and is not case sensitive. That is, any combination of the same characters with different case will be equivalent. Names entered for INSTNAM must be unique for any given parameter, but names may be reused for instances associated with different parameters.
repetitions of Item 4b are required; they are read by module
utility module applies to Qfact). The
repetitions of Item 4b follow each repetition of Item 4a when

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Qfact—is the factor used to calculate well recharge rate from the parameter value. The recharge rate is the product of Qfact and the parameter value.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: ITMP—is a flag and a counter.

li.text: If ITMP < 0, non-parameter well data from the last stress period will be reused.
0, ITMP will be the number of non-parameter wells read for the current stress period.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NP—is the number of parameters in use in the current stress period.
repetitions of Item 6 are read by module
utility module applies to Q.) Item 6 is not read if

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Q—is the volumetric recharge rate. A positive value indicates recharge and a negative value indicates discharge (pumping).
times. It is not read if
is negative or 0. Iname is read if Pname is a time-varying parameter.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Pname—is the name of a parameter that is being used in the current stress period. NP parameter names will be read.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Iname – is an instance name that is read only if Pname is a time-varying parameter. Multiple instances of the same time-varying parameter are not allowed in a stress period.
